go home. 11.03 am: Two gilded wooden statues of Tutankhamun are among 18 items missing from the Egyptian museum in Cairo, after looters stole several items during the anti-government protests, the Associated Press reports. On January 28, looters climbed a fire escape to the museum roof and lowered themselves on ropes from a glass pane ceiling onto the museum's top floor. Around 70 objects were damaged, but until Sunday's announcement, it was not known whether anything was missing. Antiquities Minister Zahi Hawass said the museum's database department determined 18 objects were gone. Investigators were
